review:
"Tank Destroyer" ist ein kleiner, minimalistischer isometrischer Top-Down-Shooter.

Die Mechanik ist extrem simpel: wir sind ein blauer Panzer und mÃ¼ssen rote Panzer abschieÃŸen. Gesteuert wird mit WASD, gezielt mit der Maus. Die Level sind klein und nicht abwechslungsreich und dennoch macht dieses Mini-Gelegenheitsspiel durchaus eine Ã¼berschaubare kurze Zeit SpaÃŸ. Denn die Spielmechanik ist direkt und funktioniert, wenn auch sehr simpel. 

Grafisch ist das Unity-Gamechen extrem reduziert, um nicht zu sagen hÃ¤ÃŸlich. Auch die Sounds erinnern eher an lÃ¤ngst vergangene Zeiten und die Musik hat durchaus einen gewissen Nervfaktor.

Es mag daran liegen, daÃŸ ich C64-Games in ihrer oft vorhandenen Einfachheit zu schÃ¤tzen weiÃŸ, aber ich kann mit so einem minimalistischen Spielchen fÃ¼r Zwischendurch durchaus was anfangen.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1649567693}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right handâ€”the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bedâ€”the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1689672420}
review:
[b][quote][url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asset_flip]Warning: Asset Flip![/url][/quote][/b]Tank Destroyer is an asset flip, or what Valve calls a "Fake Game". The "developer" paid for/pirated someone else's example/template/tutorial game, changed the name/reskinned a couple of things, and submitted it to Valve as if it was their own game.

Freedomize Studio have a known history of trying to scam people into paying them money for someone else's work, through this account or through closely linked/alt accounts.  One example of Freedomize Studio doing this is [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/440760]Cube Destroyer[/url], which is really the "[url=https://dkonline.cheapsalesonline2023.com/content?c=unity+3d+top+down+shooter&id=26]Top Down Shooter Pack[/url]" asset, used without even crediting the actual creator.

Taking this shovelware seriously as if it was a genuine attempt to make a game, it doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The game features lazy minimalist/untextured low-polygon "retro" assets and visuals, making this look like a barely functional 3D game from the early 1990s.  The lack of textures is a method that lazy devs often use to disguise their lack of talent/interest in doing the graphics properly and trying to disguise it under the name of "art", or "We made it look bad on purpose", which really isn't something gamers should have to put up with.  It's unclear why the developers weren't willing to arrange high quality, high polygon count contemporary assets and high resolution textures for the game.  It looks bad as a result of their decisions, and that's just another reason to avoid it.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the game unplayable for differently-abled gamers, or gamers using AZERTY or other international keyboard layouts.  

These technical defects push this game below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Reviewing SteamDB to check how popular this game was with players reveals a surprise... there's a very healthy spike in player counts for the game.  But this only appears around the same time that trading cards were applied to the game... so this is just card idlers getting their cards and moving on.  A closer look at the numbers shows the game just has a couple of players every week running up the game and idling it for cards, then deleting it.  We must ask how it benefits gamers for there to be so many games like this, with no merit as a serious game, that only generate sales from people idling and selling the trading cards.

Tank Destroyer has the far too high price of around $5 USD, it's not worth it given the defects and shortcomings with the product, especially considering the unethical nature of the developer.  Remember that if you buy a game from an unethical developer, you're putting your money at risk.

author: {'steamid': '76561199070369348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1666678776}
review:
This game is very simple an quite fun. 
Youre a tank that roams a map with enemy tanks and exchange bullets in a firefights to kill one another.
It could be better.
The graphics could be more crisp.
There could me more unlockables an achievements.
This game does feature trading cards. 

Game is quite repetitive in some forms.

4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198958608463', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1314, 'last_played': 1624106385}
review:
PASTAS
Canelones de espinaca y ricota
Pasta casera rellena muy fÃ¡cil y riquÃ­sima.

Ingredientes
PARA LA MASA

500 cc de leche.

250 g de harina 0000.

25 g de manteca derretida.

Sal.

2 huevos.

PARA EL RELLENO

500 g de ricota firme.

500 g de espinaca.

100 g de queso rallado.

Una cebolla.

2 dientes de ajo.

PARA LA SALSA BLANCA

50 g de manteca.

50 g de harina.

500 cc de leche.

Sal y pimienta, a gusto.

Nuez moscada.

PARA LA SALSA DE TOMATES

Un diente de ajo.

50 cc de vino tinto.

Una lata de tomates perita.

50 g de queso rallado fino.

Procedimiento
1Para la masa, integrar los ingredientes con un batidor de mano.

2Dejar reposar 20 minutos en la heladera.

3Cocinar en una sartÃ©n antiadherente con manteca.

4Para el relleno, saltear la cebolla junto al ajo. Reservar.

5En un bowl, colocar la espinaca cocida y escurrida, la ricota, los condimentos, el queso y el salteado de cebolla.

6Para la salsa blanca, derretir la manteca y agregar la harina y cocinar durante un minuto.

7Agregar la leche caliente fuera del fuego.

8Revolver con batidor y volver al fuego hasta que hierva.

9Condimentar con sal, pimienta y nuez moscada, tapar con un film en contacto y reservar.

10Para la salsa de tomates, dorar el ajo, agregar el tomate.

11Salpimentar y cocinar unos minutos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032345325', 'num_games_owned': 2730, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1561787697}
review: I am a 45 -year -old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father raising my son, who is now 14 years old. My son won this game from his uncle, so we installed him on his computer and he started playing. Until the end of the week he had 24 hours in this game. This was horrible for me, because it was hard to find ways to spend time with my son, because he is always with friends or just watching Youtube. So I decided to do a Steam account and get this game to see if I could play beside him. I bought the game, chose my skin and world and started playing, but I was stuck in what you should do. I asked my son for help and he organized a game for me to participate. I loved it, because it was the best time I spent with my son since my wife died. Since then, this game has approached me and my son again and now we spend time together away from home as well. This game reminded me that there is fun in everything, and I brought many happy memories to me and my son.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183447479', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1559516710}

author: {'steamid': '76561198296212662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1609533124}
review: Well I have had this game for ages but I play it on and off. Every time I go on the game, I tell myself to play for 5 or 10 minutes but I realise that I spent 30 minutes to a hour playing the game. The game basic and easy to learn but hard to master. The tanks you go against are more powerful than you and you never really know where the tanks are because you don@t see the full level. In the end I find this a good game and I wish it would be updated

author: {'steamid': '76561198073342595', 'num_games_owned': 646, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 177, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1549586379}

author: {'steamid': '76561198101528678', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1702915525}
review: Vot reshil viskazat's'a. Koroten'kaya, proshel vs'u ighru i vse eshe moghu sdelat' vozvrat. Krasivaya ghrafika, horoshaya muzika. Otlichnaya optimizacia, prostoe upravlenie, sam ighrovoy proces dovol'no dinamichen. Vnachale budet slozhno, no potom mozhno priviknut' k osobenost'am povedenia botov. Oni ne ochen' umnie, poetomu dizayn urovney daet im nekotoroe preimushestvo. Vraghov vsegho 3 vida. Nikakih bonusov. Bosov net. Ne hvataet multipleera. Ya kak raz iskal nechto podobnoe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058457238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1538336669}
review: This game was too short. It took me about 10 minutes to get through levels 1-5 while i got used to the controls and AI. After i got used to that, the last few levels were incredibly easy. Its not a bad game by any means, but i cant reccomend it at a cost of 3$. I spent 3$ and only got about 30 minutes of gameplay. I couldve gotten the same quality of gameplay on a flash game and saved my money.

review:
Kinda fun and short, not a great game (AI is a glaring issue and level design is very uninspired) but hey it's only â‚¬1.
Took me a bit less than half an hour to beat. Fairly replayable, music was pretty nice. Pretty relaxing for the most part, although the AI got frustrating at times.
Pick it up if you're into this kind of thing and have a buck to spare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344472710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1508288146}
review:
I rarely check out games that are less than a dollar because most of the time it is a copy and paste of another game or it required minimal effort. But as I was leveling up my steam profile and got a coupon for "Tank Destroyer" looked further into it and saw it was a rather interesting game. And the price? 49 cents. practically a steal if you ask me

The actual game portion of Tank Destroyer was a very pleasant surprise, launched the game and you're met with the launcher, change your settings and you're good to go. 20 levels, starting from easy and progressing to challenging and then on to difficult. The only gripe I really had about the game was that the camera angle was awkward. Getting rekt out of nowhere from down south was fairly annoying but getting used to it was easy, [spoiler] as all you had to do was clear from south to north. [/spoiler]

Overall very glad I purchased the game, now I wouldn't pay more than 49 cents for a game that I might only get 2 hours out of but I won't be refunding it. There are many ways you can challenge yourself while playing the game, and I do believe I will come back to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088666959', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1645448781}
review:
Fun little tank game i got for 49 cents.

Some people think it is too hard, well, yeah it is hard. But think about it, if it was easy, you would finish it in 30 mins. 

Even so, it only took me around an hour to complete, worth the 49 cents.

However i wish there was more detail, and a custom map editor would have been lovely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170244305', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1504264469}
review:
>gets another game
>idles for cards
>crafts badge for different game
>gets coupon for this game (90% off)
>buys game at 30c
>plays 5 levels then quits cause 1v3 g0d DaM TanKS aRE to OP
>gets card drop for this game
>checks market for price
>realises they sell at 15c each
>profit.

Jokes aside, this game isn't the best, it's one of those ''made in a hour crappy knock off's".
Multiple things:
-First 4 levels are easy(ish), level 5 takes it out of the ball park. 
-Terrible FPS even with low settings.
-There are a extremely low amount of levels for it's standard $3 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148229515', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1503582003}
review:
So first of all, the game isn't bad, i can recommend it but only if you buy this for 0,10â‚¬ (90% coupon discount).

[h1] So what is this game about? [/h1]
Well as you can see in the tags and trailer this game is a Shoot'em up with some tactical thinking aspect. The game is pretty much minimalistic. The menu has only 3 options and the one that is in the middle has only 2 sliders for sound settings. When you click on the "play" button the game shows you some levels (of course on start you only see level 1)

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

The gameplay is.. well this is a minimalistic game. You steer a tank and you try to kill all the enemies in your way. [b] It's pretty good for 2 hours of gameplay but after 2h the game is just boring. [/b] Not only that but the game has no real replayability. 

[h1] Frustrating parts of the game [/h1]
The most frustrating parts of the game were probably bad level design, lack of new game mechanics and AI, wich shoots at player while not being seeable by him. 


[h1] Would you recommend the game? [/h1]
For card hunter? Sure, but for somone how would like to play? No. There are much better shoot'em up on steam that aren't that much more expensive.

review:
Playable, but that's about it. Spend less than 50 cents to purchase. Adequate. No real replayability, seemed more like a tiny project through Unity. Only real gripe is that the AI is able to see you off screen. Not a huge deal.

Can't really recommend at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332193077', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1639372127}
review:
Very nice, cheap game. Got it for 50 cents on sale, and it was totally worth it. It's very difficult, unlike other tank games, where enemies seem to "throw" themselves at you, this game's AI is remarkably cunning, as they will literally set up traps and abushes for you, and the map design favors patience.

I would have to say 10/10 AI, 10/10 music, 10/10 map design, and just an overall 10/10. (no i'm not going to go into more detail. Don't got time for dat)

To all of you who say that you can't get past lv. 4 or that the game in general is impossible, I would like to say you're mistaken.

I will say I was stumped for a while at lv. 4, but I was eventually able to overcome it with PATIENCE. PATIENCE is what you need in this game. Impacient people who rush this game will of corse get stuck due to the AI's clever tactics.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962535997', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1494828560}
review:
I'd recommend only getting this game if it's on sale, or if you get a coupon for it, etc.  I can't really say it's worth 3 bucks, considering there are free flash games that offer more customization, and longer gameplay.  I've already beaten it in an hour.

That being said, it is a fun little top-down shooter.  Feels unfair for a little bit considering the enemies can see you outside of your own range, but you'll get used to it.  If more were included, such as power ups, more levels, etc., it'd be great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123126542', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1515356741}
review:
Tank Destroyer is a hard, very fun game. There isn't many faults with this game, just missing a lot of things in the gameplay. The dev is missing a lot of key features that could improve the game a lot. It is very obvious they spent little time creating the game. I personally would only purchase the game when on a discount.

Pros:

â—‰ Cheap.
â—‰ Simplistic.
â—‰ Good soundtrack.
â—‰ Very enjoyable.
â—‰ Easy to play.

Cons:

â—‰ Only a singleplayer, adding a multiplayer would be very fun.
â—‰ Add a tank customization, to have different tank colors, models, etc.
â—‰ Add a level editor.
â—‰ Add upgrades and or powerups.
â—‰ Levels get quite hard, which is fine if you enjoy the challenge.
â—‰ The dev is not very involved, and has already left this small game.

[h1] Overall rating, I give this game a 6 out of 10. Worthy price: $1.99 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198008480062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1542831538}
review:
Gioco spettacolare e molto fluido.
Le dinamiche e le meccaniche del gioco sono molto intuitive e semplice.
Le musiche sono epiche e fantastiche.
Musica tecno ad alti livelli.
Consigliatissimo per gli amanti del genere e della musica remix.
In poche parole lo consiglio vivamente

author: {'steamid': '76561198048832551', 'num_games_owned': 2525, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1527182602}
review:
For those who dont like to read: It is fun and worth the 0.99â‚¬ in my opinion.

But i wish this was a higher priced early access title. 
Right now there are 20 levels with 3 different enemy types. 

And while it is indeed fun it is also quite short. 
According to steam i spent 31 minutes in the game and that includes launcher, menu, etc. 
(I have finished it) 
I just wish there was more to it. 

- More enemies
- Different Terrain types that make your tank slower / faster / hard to see / etc.
- Destroyable walls (Not everywhere ofc)
- Level editor
- Colour customization
- Upgrades / Power ups
- More levels (Duh)
- Different weapons
- Coop / Versus modes 

Well enough of what i would have liked and onto something that is there and in my opinion needs some fixing. 

There are 2 problems that i had while playing:
1. Shots coming from outside the screen
I would say around 30-40% of my deaths were to tanks that were outside of my screen and that i didnt know of 

2. On the bigger maps when there is only 1 enemy tank left it can take a bit to find it (also problem 1)

In my opinion this would be much better if the tanks left tracks behind and destroyed tanks left some kind of mark on the level.

That way you could track the tanks down and you could atleast get a vague idea of where the enemies are right now. 

So if you dont mind dying and youre looking for a short game this might be it

I just hope that the dev uses this game as a foundation for a second bigger title because it is fun and has potential.
